item.title: Chris Malone
item.executiveBio:
Chris Malone is the Chief Executive Officer and a board member at Applause. Chris joined Applause in 2013 and served as both chief financial officer and president, prior to his appointment as CEO. Chris has been instrumental in Applause’s growth and international expansion.

Prior to Applause, Chris worked at NTT Data, a top five global IT service provider, as the CFO of the North American business, responsible for financial oversight and operations of a billion-dollar operating unit. Chris took on that role after successfully exiting Keane to NTT Data in 2010. Prior to NTT Data, Chris held a number of leadership roles in finance, sales & operations. Chris began his career at KPMG and is a Certified Public Accountant.

Chris received his bachelor’s degree and MBA from Babson College in 2000. Chris serves as the Chair on the Babson College Advisory Board.
item.executiveBlurb: As CEO, Chris drives company strategy and growth, with a focus on customer success.

metaGlobalVars.seoTitle: Chris Malone | CEO of Applause, Board Member
metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: As Chief Executive Officer, Chris drives company strategy and growth, with a focus on customer success.

item.title: Chris Malone
item.executiveBio:
Chris Malone is the Chief Executive Officer and a Board Member at Applause. Chris joined Applause in 2013 and served as both Chief Financial Officer and President, prior to his appointment as CEO.

Since joining Applause, Chris has taken the company through multiple rounds of financing with leading investors such as Goldman Sachs and Accenture, and stewarded the company through its acquisition by Vista Equity Partners in 2017. Chris has been instrumental in Applause’s growth and international expansion.

Prior to joining Applause, Chris worked at NTT Data, a top five global IT service provider, as the CFO of the North American Business, responsible for financial oversight and operations of a billion-dollar operating unit. Chris took on that role after successfully exiting Keane to NTT Data in 2010. Prior to NTT Data, Chris held a number of leadership roles in Finance, Sales & Operations. Chris began his career at KPMG and is a Certified Public Accountant (CPA).

Chris received his Bachelor’s degree and MBA from Babson College in 2000. Chris serves as the Chair on the Babson College Advisory Board.

metaGlobalVars.seoTitle: Chris Malone | CEO of Applause, Board Member
metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: As CEO and a Board Member at Applause, Chris drives the company strategy and growth, with a focus on customer success.

item.title: Tom Bonos
item.executiveTitle: Chief Revenue Officer & Chief Operations Officer
item.executiveBio:
Tom Bonos is the Chief Revenue Officer and Chief Operations Officer at Applause. Tom drives the vision and execution of the global sales strategy and leads the company’s revenue generation and customer operations teams. Under his leadership, Applause has expanded its global footprint and achieved exponential growth, while ensuring our customers realize the value of Applause at each stage of their lifecycle.

Tom came to Applause with 15+ years of sales leadership. Most recently, he served as the executive vice president of sales for ServiceSource. Prior to ServiceSource, Tom was a group vice president at Oracle. Tom has also held leadership roles at SAP America and Benchmarking Partners/Surgency.

Tom graduated from Lehigh University with a degree in economics and geological sciences. Tom lives in Florida with his wife and children.
item.executiveBlurb: As CRO & COO, Tom drives the vision and execution of the global sales strategy and customer operations teams.

metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: As CRO & COO, Tom drives the vision and execution of the global sales strategy and customer operations teams.

item.title: Rob Mason
item.executiveBio:
Rob Mason has more than 20 years of operational, management, and software development experience across various companies, languages, platforms and technologies. A meticulous builder and obsessive tester, Rob’s teams produce innovative, robust software.

Prior to Applause, Rob was founder and executive vice president of engineering at Nasuni, where he took the company from initial product concept to more than 10 petabytes of managed storage consisting of billions of files in a global file system. Prior to Nasuni, Rob oversaw all development and quality assurance as the VP of engineering at Archivas.

Rob holds over 30 patents including several in the area of test automation. He has a Bachelor of Science degree from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute and an MBA degree with honors from Rutgers University. Rob lives on a horse farm in Massachusetts with his wife.
item.executiveBlurb: As CTO, Rob is responsible for all of our developmental efforts across a half-dozen locations throughout the world.

metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: As Chief Technology Officer, Rob Mason is responsible for leading his team to produce innovative and robust software.

item.title: Luke Damian
item.executiveBio:
Luke is the Chief Growth Officer at Applause. He owns the go-to-market strategy for the company, including its marketing and sales operations functions.

With a focused eye on accelerating growth, Luke brings 20+ years of operating experience to Applause from national leadership positions at Oracle and EMC. During his tenure with Oracle, he led sales, business development and customer success initiatives across multiple growth priorities including solution development, strategic customer acquisition and engagement, and customer retention programs. Earlier in his career, Luke held significant roles at EMC serving in various leadership positions across sales and business development.

Luke holds an MBA and a BS from Babson College. He also earned an Executive Certificate in Strategy and Innovation from MIT’s Sloan School of Management.
item.executiveBlurb: As CGO, Luke owns the Go-to-Market Strategy for the company, including its Marketing & Product functions.

metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: As Chief Growth Officer, Luke owns the Go-to-Market Strategy for the company, including its Marketing & Product functions.

item.title: Bradley Batchelder
item.executiveBio:
As Chief People Officer at Applause, Bradley is passionate about building inclusive cultures, embracing innovation and creating memorable employee experiences. He has helped Applause earn its reputation as a high-growth company by cultivating a diverse culture. As a result, Applause is consistently recognized as a top place to work both locally and globally by organizations like Inc. Magazine, Boston Business Journal and the Boston Globe.

Along with building a culture of collaboration, Bradley makes supporting Applause’s surrounding community a priority. Applause’s volunteer and fundraising efforts have been recognized by the United Way with awards including the Live United Award and the Good Neighbor Award.

Prior to joining Applause, Bradley held roles in recruiting and talent acquisition at Monster and Enterprise Search.
item.executiveBlurb: As Chief People Officer at Applause, Bradley is passionate about building inclusive cultures.

metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: As Chief People Officer at Applause, Bradley is passionate about building inclusive cultures, embracing innovation and creating memorable employee experiences.

item.title: Jan Wolter
item.executiveTitle: Head of Product & Managing Director, Applause EU
item.executiveBio:
As SVP of Product and General Manager at Applause EU, Jan leads our product organization and sets the strategic roadmap. Partnering with Engineering, his organization ensures we build solutions that address ongoing key customer business challenges. In addition, Jan leads European operations. As such, he ensures that Applause Europe meets its revenue and customer acquisition goals while maintaining the highest levels of quality and customer satisfaction.

Before joining Applause, Jan was CEO and co-founder of Testhub, which was acquired by Applause in May 2014. Jan has long supported companies from different sectors in implementing and scaling innovative software testing solutions for years before joining Applause.

Jan holds a Master of Science degree from London School of Economics and a Bachelor of Science degree from University of Mannheim, Germany.
item.executiveBlurb: Jan leads as General Manager the European operations of Applause and is responsible for growing the business overseas.

metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: Jan leads as General Manager the European operations of Applause and is responsible for growing the business overseas.

item.title: Julia Zacharias
item.executiveTitle: SVP of EMEA Customer Operations & Accessibility Practice Lead
item.executiveBio:
As SVP EMEA of Customer Operations, Julia oversees Solution Delivery, Testing Services, and Community Management in the EMEA region. In this role, she drives expansion, retention, operational excellence and continuous improvement in close alignment with Sales and Product. She also leads the European part of the global accessibility practice and helps clients create inclusive and legally compliant digital experiences for their end customers.

Julia has 15 years of experience leading large scale organizational transformations as a consultant at Kearney and project portfolio manager at Kion Group. She developed and led programs to drive operational excellence based on lean methods and enablement across all hierarchies, mainly for German 500 companies in the utilities, transportation and manufacturing sector. Earlier in her career, Julia worked as a public sector consultant focused on regional economic growth and industrial policy.

Julia holds a Master's Degree in Economics and Political Sciences from Freie Universität Berlin and has been a visiting student at Princeton University and Harvard University. She is a Certified Program Consultant for SAFe (Scaled Agile) and a Systemic Coach.

metaGlobalVars.seoTitle: Julia Zacharias | SVP of EMEA Customer Operations
metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: As SVP EMEA of Customer Operations, Julia oversees Solution Delivery, Testing Services, and Community Management in the EMEA region.

item.title: Liza Landsman
item.executiveBio:
Liza Landsman​ is ​a General Partner at New Enterprise Associates, Inc. (NEA) focused on investments in the consumer, ecommerce, and fintech sectors. Prior to joining NEA​ in 2018​, Liza was President of Jet.com where she was a founding member of the executive team and later, following Jet’s acquisition, of Walmart’s US Ecommerce leadership team. Prior to joining Jet, she was Chief Marketing Officer and a member of the Executive Committee at E*TRADE Financial, Global Head of Digital for BlackRock and held various leadership roles at both Citigroup and IBM earlier in her career.

In addition to her involvement with NEA portfolio companies, Liza is an independent Board Director for Choice Hotels (CHH), Squarespace and Applause as well as the NYC based non-profit organization The GO Project. Liza graduated magna cum laude from Cornell University.

metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: Liza Landsman​ is ​a General Partner at New Enterprise Associates, Inc. (NEA) focused on investments in the consumer, ecommerce, and fintech sectors.

item.title: Michael Fosnaugh
item.executiveBio:
Michael Fosnaugh has worked at Vista Equity Partners since 2005. Mr. Fosnaugh is Co-Head of the Flagship Fund and sits on its Investment Committee. Additionally, Mr. Fosnaugh serves as a member of Vista’s Executive Committee, the firm’s governing and decision-making body for matters affecting its overall management and strategic direction, and Vista’s Private Equity Management Committee, the firm’s decision-making body for matters affecting Vista’s overall private equity platform.

Mr. Fosnaugh currently sits on the boards of Acquia, Alegeus, Applause, CentralSquare, EAB, Greenway Health, Integral Ad Science (NASDAQ: IAS), Jamf (NASDAQ: JAMF), Mediaocean, Ping Identity (NYSE: PING), PlanSource, SmartBear, Stats Perform and TripleLift. He was actively involved in the firm’s investments in Advicent, Forcepoint, MRI Software, Numerator, SirsiDynix, Sunquest Information Systems, Websense and Zywave. Mr. Fosnaugh is Co-Head of the Chicago office.

Prior to joining Vista, Mr. Fosnaugh worked in the Technology, Media and Telecommunications Group at SG Cowen & Co., where he focused on the software, services and financial technology sectors. While at SG Cowen, Mr. Fosnaugh advised clients on buy-side and sell-side transactions, public and private equity financings, and other strategic advisory initiatives.

metaGlobalVars.seoTitle: Michael Fosnaugh | Vista Equity Partners, Board Member
metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: Michael Fosnaugh has worked at Vista Equity Partners since 2005. Mr. Fosnaugh is Co-Head of the Flagship Fund and sits on its Investment Committee.

item.title: Jason Mills
item.executiveBio:
Jason Mills joined Applause's Board of Directors in August of 2021. An established leader in the technology industry, his focus is on technology and business strategy, innovation and digital transformation for Fortune 100 companies and supports Applause’s mission to empower the world’s leading companies to deliver exceptional digital experiences.

Mr. Mills is the Vice President and Head of Snowflake's Sales Engineering business where he leads the industry-aligned team responsible for the top 300+ customers in finance, healthcare & life sciences, retail, telecom, media & entertainment, technology, and public sector. Previously Mr. Mills was Executive Director and Head of Customer Engineering Cloud Industries at Google where he built and launched the first industry aligned engineering team.

Prior to his work at Google, Mills held several technology leadership roles at JP Morgan Chase and Citigroup with over 30 years of Technology and Engineering experience. He also co-founded BLISTS, Inc., a non-profit organization specializing in technology and economic development in underdeveloped communities.

metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: Jason Mills joined Applause's Board of Directors in August of 2021. Mills is an established leader in the technology industry.

item.title: Jeff Wilson
item.executiveBio:
Jeff Wilson has worked at Vista Equity Partners since 2015 and is currently the Managing Director of the private equity Flagship team. Mr. Wilson currently sits on the boards and is actively involved in the firm’s investments in Alegeus, Allvue Systems, Applause, DealerSocket, PlanSource, SmartBear and Xactly. He was actively involved in the firm’s investment in Vertafore.

Prior to joining Vista, Mr. Wilson was a Principal at TPG Capital and helped lead their software and financial technology investing. Mr. Wilson spent over 11 years at TPG Capital where he led over $4.7 billion in equity investments, including investments in software platforms Vertafore, GlobeOp, Eze Software Group, Advent Software, Box and GreenSky TradeCredit. Before TPG Capital, Mr. Wilson was an investment banker at Morgan Stanley in their Technology group and Financial Sponsors group.

metaGlobalVars.seoTitle: Jeff Wilson | Vista Equity Partners, Board Member
metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: Jeff Wilson has worked at Vista Equity Partners since 2015 and is currently a member of the private equity Flagship team.

item.title: Nick Prickel
item.executiveBio:
Nick Prickel is a senior vice president and member of the private equity Flagship team at Vista Equity Partners. Mr. Prickel currently sits on the boards of Applause, Gainsight, iCIMS and Smartbear and works with the firm’s investments in Aptean, Granicus, Jamf and Solera. He was actively involved with Vista’s investments in Aderant, Advanced, BigMachines, DealerSocket, Greenway Health and Social Solutions. From January 2015 to June 2016, Mr. Prickel worked for Aptean as the Director of Strategic Operations, where he helped lead the company’s acquisition and operational integration of multiple acquisitions.

Prior to joining Vista, Mr. Prickel worked at Rothschild in New York. While at Rothschild, Mr. Prickel provided advisory services to technology and industrial companies on a broad range of transactions including mergers, acquisitions, financings and other corporate strategic activities. He holds a B.S. in Biomedical Engineering and Economics from Washington University in St. Louis, summa cum laude.

metaGlobalVars.seoTitle: Nick Prickel | Vista Equity Partners, Board Member
metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: Nick Prickel is a vice president and member of the private equity Flagship team at Vista Equity Partners.

item.title: Suzanne Gilfix
item.executiveBio:
Suzanne is the General Counsel and Vice President at Applause, responsible for the worldwide legal function for Applause and its subsidiaries. Suzanne oversees corporate governance and leads diversity; equity and inclusion; environment; social and governance initiatives.

Suzanne is a trusted advisor with 20+ years of highly diverse expertise in commercial law, compliance, data privacy, litigation, civil rights, IPO and more. She leads processes to minimize risk and grow customer acquisition and retention.

Suzanne has served on nonprofit boards: the Anti-Defamation League of New England; the Tyler Foundation in affiliation with Children’s Hospital; New England Corporate Counsel Association; and The Global Good Fund, mentoring young entrepreneurs.

Suzanne holds a Bachelor of Arts from Harvard College and JD from Boston University School of Law.
item.executiveBlurb: Suzanne leads the worldwide legal function and is responsible for corporate governance and key DEI initiatives.

metaGlobalVars.seoTitle: Suzanne Gilfix | General Counsel and Vice President
metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: Suzanne is the General Counsel and Vice President at Applause. She is responsible for the worldwide legal function for Applause and its subsidiaries.

item.title: Heather Levy Sigel
item.executiveBio:
Heather Levy Sigel is the SVP of Corporate Strategy & Development. She acts as a chief of staff to the CEO and has responsibility for corporate strategy, corporate development, and Applause's partnership & alliance channel.

Most recently, Heather worked at Deloitte Consulting. At Deloitte, she worked with Fortune 100 companies to develop and implement strategies to improve organizational performance and efficiency.

She graduated from Cornell University with a degree in industrial & labor relations and she received her MBA from the Tuck School at Dartmouth College.
item.executiveBlurb: Heather serves as our SVP of Corporate Strategy & Development and has responsibility for corporate strategy, corporate development, and partnerships.

metaGlobalVars.seoTitle: Heather Levy Sigel | SVP of Corporate Strategy & Development
metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: Heather serves as our SVP of Corporate Strategy & Development and has responsibility for corporate strategy, corporate development, and partnerships.

item.title: Christopher Jolie
item.executiveBio:
Christopher Jolie is the Chief Financial Officer at Applause, managing the corporate areas of Finance & Accounting, IT and Business Applications & Systems. Chris is focused on delivering business oversight, strategic financial planning and process improvement across Applause.

Prior to joining Applause, Chris worked at NTT DATA Services, a top five global IT service provider. During his 17+ year tenure at NTT DATA, Chris held several high-profile roles including head of corporate financial planning & analysis, CFO of the Healthcare & Life-Science divisions and, most recently, CFO of the Manufacturing division. While at NTT Data Services, Chris played an active role in the NTT DATA acquisition of Keane, Inc., multiple M&A activities and financial oversight of $500M+ divisions. Prior to NTT DATA Services, Chris spent three years with Deutche Bank in the firm’s international equities group.

Chris received his Bachelor’s degree from Gordon College in 2000.
item.executiveBlurb: As CFO, Christopher focuses on improving business performance and profitability across Applause.

metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: As CFO, Christopher focuses on improving business performance and profitability across Applause.

item.title: Stephen Seelbach
item.executiveBio:
Stephen Seelbach joined Vista in 2014 and is Managing Director in the Office of the CEO. In his role, Mr. Seelbach leads Vista’s strategy in Asia, including investor-facing dialogue, portfolio company go-to-market activity and partnerships. He currently sits on the boards of Vista’s two joint ventures in Japan, NEC and Japan Cloud Computer, as well as Vista portfolio company Applause.

Mr. Seelbach is an active contributor to the firm’s international growth strategy, having led the opening of Vista’s offices in Hong Kong and Singapore. He is a member of the Asia Council of the Global Private Capital Association (GPCA) and the Hong Kong Venture Capital Association, and actively collaborates with the World Economic Forum. Prior to his current role, Mr. Seelbach was the Chief of Staff to Vista’s Founder, Chairman and CEO, Robert F. Smith, and involved in firm strategy, investor relations, operations and other cross firm and functional projects.

Prior to joining Vista, Mr. Seelbach was a Managing Director at Morgan Stanley in Hong Kong, where he led the Asia-Pacific Financial Sponsors group. He worked at Morgan Stanley for 15 years in Hong Kong, Singapore and New York, including time in the Mergers and Acquisitions, Capital Markets and Corporate Finance groups.

Mr. Seelbach is an avid squash player and serves as the Board Chair of Squash Drive in San Francisco/Oakland and is also Deputy Board Chair of St. Luke’s Preschool in San Francisco.

metaGlobalVars.seoTitle: Stephen Seelbach | Vista Equity Partners, Board Member
metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: Stephen Seelbach is a vice president and member of the private equity Flagship team at Vista Equity Partners.

item.title: Leanne Orphanos
item.executiveBio:
As Senior Vice President of Customer Operations, Leanne implements strategies that drive customer success, retention and operational excellence for North America. She also oversees our strategic practices and global community of testers.

Leanne brings over 25 years of experience to Applause from leadership positions at NTT Data and PricewaterhouseCoopers (PWC). At NTT Data, Leanne executed complex, global initiatives spanning business transformation, acquisition and integration efforts, global financial system and business intelligence implementations, as well as operational optimization. She also improved business processes and systems that drove more effective resource utilization, business controls and cost management metrics across five key delivery centers. Earlier in her career, Leanne was focused on sales and business development, client service delivery and business process and controls consulting at PWC.

Leanne received her bachelor's degree from Tufts University.
item.executiveBlurb: Leanne leads the N.A. Customer Operations team, implementing strategies that drive customer success, retention and operational excellence.

metaGlobalVars.seoTitle: Leanne Orphanos | SVP of Customer Operations
metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: Leanne leads the N.A. Customer Operations team, implementing strategies that drive customer success, retention and operational excellence.

item.title: Chris Sheehan
item.executiveBio:
As SVP and GM, Strategic Accounts, Chris enables the success of Applause’s strategic account business including strategy, sales and operations to ensure continued growth and customer success of Applause’s largest customers. Since joining Applause in 2015, Chris has held roles on multiple teams at Applause including software delivery, product strategy and customer success.

Chris has over 22 years of experience with high-growth companies as an operating executive, investor and board member. Prior to Applause, Chris was COO of venture-backed TrueLens, a SaaS data platform. Previous experience includes seven years as a general partner of an early-stage technology VC fund, and operating roles at enterprise software company BEA Systems and Stax, a global strategy consulting firm.

Chris holds a Bachelor of Commerce degree from the University of Queensland, Australia.
item.executiveBlurb: Chris drives Applause’s Strategic Account business, ensuring the growth and success of our largest customers.

metaGlobalVars.seoDescription: Chris is responsible for Applause’s Strategic Account business, ensuring the continued growth and customer success of Applause’s largest customers.
